poem:
"An Ode to Wendy's Melodies"

Strains of violin kissed by woman's hand,
Within life's score, her notes found grand.
From Beethoven's embrace to Centipede's wing,
In timeless dance, her music sings.
An autumn leaf, once pinned to sky,
Now in silence, both soft and sly.
From her bow's measured drag to free jazz's flight,
Wendy's legacy whispers in the night.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Wendy Ritson obituary My grandmother Wendy Ritson, who has died aged 90, was a classically trained violinist. She became a member of the prog rock band Centipede under her married name, Wendy Treacher. Founded by the jazz pianist Keith Tippett in 1970, Centipede was made up of about 50 musicians who came together to record a double album, Septober Energy, in 1971. A sprawling creation, the LP consisted of four movements each lasting 20 minutes,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Wendy Ritson obituary My grandmother Wendy Ritson, who has died aged 90, was a classically trained violinist. She became a member of the prog rock band Centipede under her married name, Wendy Treacher. Founded by the jazz pianist Keith Tippett in 1970, Centipede was made up of about 50 musicians who came together to record a double album, Septober Energy, in 1971. A sprawling creation, the LP consisted of four movements each lasting 20 minutes,
